TopicTitle: Hypothesis tests - what if the critical value is the same as the test stat.?

Articles.Content: So the title is fairly self-explanatory. If the critical value is exactly the same as the test statistic in a hypothesis test, should the null hypothesis be accepted or rejected?

The results are usually quoted as p<value. you="" cannot="" reject="" on="" p="value." although,="" if="" they="" are="" coming="" out="" exactly="" equal,="" i="" would="" try="" to="" get="" a="" bit="" more="" data="" or="" to="" improve="" computation="" precision="" to="" make=""></value.>
